text: hi everyone today I'm making a pretty
and colorful desserts called one book
man they look like caviar balls slightly
chewy on the outsides and soft and sweet
with the mung bean fillings on the
inside if you are a dessert lover you
definitely have to give this recipe a
try let's begin you will need to cut
cuff or 150 gram of small tapioca pearls
have a cup or 100 gram of split mung
beans coconut milk sugar and pandan
leaves for the sauce to make natural
food color you might also need red meat
and purple cabbage for the small tapioca
pearls you might or might not have to
soak in water depending on the brand my
need to be soaked in water for about
half an hour for the peeled split mung
beans you want to wash them clean and
then soak in water for an hour after
that cooked in a rice cooker with one
cup of water then you are spoon to mash
them into a paste transfer the mung bean
paste into a saucepan and four
tablespoons of sugar and half a cup of
vegetable oil or you can also use
coconut milk stirring on low heat until
all the ingredients are well
incorporated and the mung bean paste is
no longer sticky then shape them into
small balls about 1 tablespoon amount if
you want you can also add some green tea
powder to give the feeling some matcha
flavor and also a nice green color to
make the natural food colorings for the
color red peel the red bit and then cut
into small chunks then transfer into a
food processor and blend well with about
a quarter cup or 60 ml of water
after that you can force the red beet
puree through a sieve and you will get
the red natural food color to get most
of the juice out you can put it in a
piece of cheesecloth
and then squeeze out the red liquid you
can do the same with the pandan leaves
to get the green color one trick to give
this longer for later use it to pour
them into ice trays and freeze
next time you only need to take out the
red ice cubes and you have the natural
food coloring ready to use anytime after
soaking the small tapioca pearls divide
them into four bowls mix one bowl with
about one to two tablespoons of the red
beet juice the tapioca pearls will then
guide red so pretty
for the purple color just shred the red
cabbage and then soaked in water you
will get a light purple liquid which you
can use to dye the tapioca pearls purple
get the other board ID with the green
color from panglang juice and give the
final one playing whites now you want to
mix have a cup of the tapioca pearls
with a teaspoon of corn starch and a
teaspoon of sugar and mix well then put
it in a microwave for about 30 seconds
at 600 watts and then the tapioca pearls
will be cooked partially and it will
becomes quite sticky then spread a piece
of plastic wrap on a flat surface
spread out the tapioca pearls place our
filling balls in the center and then
wrap it up to shape into a nice ball
just like that you can repeat the same
with the other colors
then remove the plastic wrap and place
the boss on a piece of parchment paper
leaving some space in between each balls
so they won't stick to each other then
place them into a steamer and steam for
about 15 minutes then turn off the heat
and leave them there for another 10
minutes
so the tapioca pearls will have time to
turn trunk solutions to make the sauce
firstly you want to mix a teaspoon of
tapioca starch with half a cup of water
then combined with half a cup of coconut
milk in a small saucepan and three
tablespoons of sugar and a pinch of salt
and a few pending leaves
which should be tied into a knot and
then bring to a boy when it boys cook
for another 30 seconds and you can turn
off the heat after steamed the little
tapioca pearls will turn translucent and
they look like caviar so pretty now to
resort the delicious coconut sauce on
top and then sprinkle some cross rotters
peanuts or seasame on top wow they look
really amazing the contrast of textures
and colors are really pleasing to the
mouth and the eyes at the same time
inside that chewy tapioca pearls is the
soft and creamy filling so rich so
delicious you have to give this recipe a
try don't forget to give this video a
thumbs up and check out my other
playlists for more delicious Vietnamese
desserts and cakes and dumplings thank
you for watching bye bye
